articles.author: Pascal Rossignol
articles.description: At least one person died and more than 50 were rescued after a migrant boat trying to cross the Channel from France capsized early on Saturday, local authorities said.
articles.title: Migrant boat crossing Channel from France capsizes, at least one dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces destroyed 20 Ukrainian drones launched onto the Crimean Peninsula early on Saturday, Russia's defence ministry said.
articles.title: Russia says it destroys 20 Ukrainian drones over Crimea

articles.author: Yuddy Budiman, Hasnoor Hussain
articles.description: Malaysians in six states headed to the polls on Saturday in regional elections seen as a major test of support for Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim's nine-month old administration.
articles.title: Malaysians vote in state elections, test for Anwar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mudslides and flooding in the northwestern Chinese city of Xian killed two people and 16 others are missing, state-owned China Central Television (CCTV) reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Floods, mudslides kill two in northwestern China city

articles.author: Maximilian Heath, Miguel Lo Bianco
articles.description: In Argentina's grains fields and cattle ranches, farmers are hoping upcoming elections will bring political change and an end to years of economic uncertainty, ushering in freer markets with fewer currency controls and export limits.
articles.title: Argentine farmers back conservatives in election, hoping for freer markets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: West African leaders were weighing their next moves on Saturday as they seek to overturn a military coup in Niger that has rocked the region but also triggered a groundswell of support in the country.
articles.title: West African regional group weighs next steps on Niger

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese state media on Saturday rejected a Western claim that developed nations were shunning the country's Belt and Road Forum, while saying most of the leaders invited this year were from developing nations.
articles.title: China state media says developed nations not shunning Belt and Road Forum

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nandita Bose
articles.description: The appointment on Friday of a special counsel to investigate Hunter Biden helped ensure that the criminal probe of the president’s son will cast a long shadow over his father’s reelection campaign.
articles.title: Hunter special counsel could weigh on Biden 2024 campaign

articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer, Joseph Tanfani
articles.description: As Florida Governor Ron DeSantis scrambles to shore up his struggling run for the Republican presidential nomination, he has spent far more than any rival on courting an influential Christian conservative leader and his following in the key early voting state of Iowa.
articles.title: Exclusive: DeSantis and his backers paid $95,000 to Iowa religious leader’s group, documents show

articles.author: Fabian Hamacher
articles.description: Taiwan Vice President William Lai left on Saturday for a sensitive trip to the United States, which China has condemned and Taiwanese officials fear could prompt more Chinese military activity around the democratically governed island.
articles.title: Taiwan vice president leaves on sensitive trip to United States
